header.title: Piers Morgan slams breathtaking arrogance of Labour ‘chump’ Barry Gardiner
header.subtitle: LABOUR’S Barry Gardiner has been branded an “arrogant chump” after stopping journalists quizzing Jeremy Corbyn about the party’s ongoing anti-semitism scandal.
header.postText: Mr Corbyn was taking questions after unveiling 451 pages of uncensored documents which he claims show the NHS is up for sale in a Tory Brexit deal with the US. But when he was again asked to apologise to the Jewish community for antisemitism within the party, a visibly annoyed shadow international development secretary Mr Gardiner intervened.', 'He said: “Do you have a question about the issue we are actually discussing today or was that just an opportune moment to get a dig in about something else?”', 'His reaction was swiftly condemned on social media.', 'Good Morning Britain presenter Piers Morgan tweeted: “Wow. The breathtaking arrogance of this chump telling journalists what questions to ask.', '“They should all ignore him and pummel Corbyn about antisemitism.”', 'Mr Corbyn did go on to address the anti-semitism row later in the press conference.', 'He said: “I have made it very clear antisemitism is completely wrong in our society, our party did make it clear when I was elected leader, and after, that antisemitism was unacceptable in any form in our party or our society.', '“And did indeed offer its sympathies and apologies to those that had suffered.”',  'Today’s election event came after a torrid day for Mr Corbyn in which he refused to apologise over anti-semitism despite condemnation from the Chief Rabbi.', 'And his claims on the NHS were dismissed by the Tories who insist the documents on which he based them only explicitly mentioned the NHS four times.', 'Trade Secretary Liz Truss said: “Jeremy Corbyn is getting desperate and is out-and-out lying to the public about what these documents contain.', '“He has always believed in conspiracy theories - which is why he has failed to crack down on the scourge of antisemitism in his party.', '“This is the man that has caused huge offence by blaming an imaginary ‘Zionist lobby’ for society’s ills and now he has decided to smear UK officials too.', '“People should not believe a word that he says - this stunt is simply a smokescreen for the fact that he has no plan for Brexit and that he has been forced to admit that he wants to increase taxes for millions of families.', '“As we have consistently made clear: the NHS will not be on the table in any future trade deal and the price that the NHS pays for drugs will not be on the table.', '“This sort of conspiracy theory fuelled nonsense is not befitting of the leader of a major political party.”', 'Mr Corbyn insisted a Labour Government would be “the most anti-racist Government you’ve ever seen”.', 'He said: “Because that is what I’ve spent my whole life doing - fighting against racism - and I will die fighting against racism.”

replies.commentText: You won't say that when its gone.

It? the NHS is just a name. There is no single NHS. There is a parent organisation for each part of the UK. But that is really just high level management. Every hospital, clinic, GP is a separate organisation.Your GP is actually a private contractor working for the NHS.You can 't privatise the NHS. You can commission care at private organisations, this is typically done where it can be done quickly and cheaply. The NHS cannot borrow money to invest like the private sector can.The NHS is not efficient and relies on old technology and procedures as a result.Failures are expensive and therefore the private sector focuses on cost meaning they invest in better machinery and techniques.If the patient does well they aren 't suing.

I see Barry Gardener has been interviewed by Andrew Neill on the 'Leader's Interviews' programme tonight.  He was obviously trying to mend some of the damage done by Corbyn last night.  Well, he didn't succeed.  He was very disagreeable and he did not convince anyone.  His claims that the Tories intend selling the NHS to the Americans just came over as groundless scaremongering.  To me, he appeared as a foolish li.ar.  It was obvious what his objectives were.  He certainly could not have endeared himself to anyone.

Those at the top of the Labour party ought to be ashamed of themselves they know what they are showing of is already in the public domain and is not going to be part of the negotiations under Boris. He has said it in the past and again today.

I've been down that rabbit hole. Conspiracy theories capture the imagination and make people a lot of money. Whilst there's a place for them, what you always have to be aware of is that they can easily be started and infiltrated by people with political agenda's to influence their observer without knowledge of it. I said to myself a long time ago, the conspiracy is - there is no conspiracy. Conspiracy hides the truth. We humans function best when we deal with what's in front of us, what is real, truth, and factual in our daily lives. If we keep a watch of that, then we're halfway there!

Q: Are you going to apologise for beating your wife? A: I did not beat my wife, I do not believe in beating my wife.I am opposed to anyone beating their wife. Q: I will ask again: Do you apologise for beating your wife ? A : I did not beat my wife. There we have it folks, he will not apologise for beating his wife.

I think we could all benefit from clarification on the definition of anti semitism. Is it the criticism of the Jewish religion ? Is it criticism of the State of Israel ? Or is it both ? And which or both is against the law ?

replies.commentText: Antisemitism is criticism of the Jewish religion. However under the internationally adopted 'Rules of Conduct' criticism of the  Jewish State is also broadly included.  What has happened in effect is anti-zionism has been reclassified as antisemitism. A religion and a state are not the same.
